revised_title: Automatic Selection of Molecular Crystal Structures using Stereochemical Criteria and High-Speed Computing
tldr: This article discusses the development of a method to automatically select and refine molecular crystal structures using stereochemical criteria and high-speed computing. The technique is particularly useful for cases where heavy-atom methods or other direct phase-determination methods are not applicable. The method has been successfully applied to various crystal structures, and it is expected that with the advancement of computing technology, even more complex structures can be solved rapidly.
